BreadPudding_description: A little slimy, but so sweet.
BouquetCrepe_description: A gorgeous crêpe cone filled with edible flowers, almost too pretty to eat.
Bouillabaisse_description: Hearty seafood soup made with with lots of vegetables.
Borsch_description: A beet based soup with an interesting flavor.
Borek_description: Pastry dough filled with mashed potatoes and paprika.
Blini_description: Thin pancakes topped with cream cheese and caviar.
BlackSoup_description: An ancient soup recipe from a warrior society long ago, now lost to time.
BlackenedFish_description: Mild fish, charred with heavy spices.
Biscuit_description: Crumbly bread, not to be confused with a cookie.
Biscotti_description: Coarse, firm cookies. Good with coffee.
Bibimbap_description: The stone bowl keeps this comforting rice dish piping hot.
Beyaynetu_description: A filling meal of flatbread and an array of side dishes to eat with it.
BearCandy_description: Candy made by pouring syrup and crushed berries in fresh snow.
BeanQuesadilla_description: Gooey cheese and black beans fried flat in a crispy tortilla.
Bazin_description: Unleavened barley bread dough and hard-boiled eggs in a tomato soup.
Baumkuchen_description: Cake made by cooking layers of batter on a spindle!
BanoffeePie_description: Banana and toffee, whipped up together!
Bannock_description: Quick and firm bread with jam.
BanhMi_description: A sub sandwich filled with fresh vegetables and pickles.
BangaRice_description: Parboiled rice cooked in the juice of palm nuts.
BananaCurry_description: Chunky slices of banana coated with a spicy and flavorful coconut paste.
Baklava_description: Thinly layered filo dough over honey and seasonal nuts.
BakedSweetPotato_description: A simple baked sweet potato. Tasty on a cold day!
BakedPotato_description: The insides are hotter than lava.
BakedBeans_description: If only you had some toast to go with it.
BakedApple_description: Simply pop an apple in the oven and bake it!
Bacalaitos_description: Crispy fried cod fritters served with aioli. It's quite salty!
BabaGhanoush_description: Roasted eggplant blended with tahini, olive oil, and seasonings.
AutumnMuffin_description: A decadent muffin that's topped with powdered sugar.
AutumnCasserole_description: A filling casserole made with fall vegetables.
Atole_description: Creamy corn masa with cinnamon and vanilla.
AsparagusDelight_description: A healthy alternative to a heavy meal.
ArmoredTurnips_description: Gratin made with large turnip slices.
AppleCider_description: Bubbly soda with a bright fall flavor.
AntsonaLog_description: An easy snack that’s light but savory.
AnimalCrackers_description: Animal crackers in my soup, monkeys and rabbits loop the loop.
AncientWonder_description: Rare fish dressed in fruit and an ancient sauce. It's pungent.
AnchovyPizza_description: A salty and sweet pizza balanced out by copious amounts of cheese.
Ambrosia_description: Whipped cream mixed with tart fruit and marshmallows.
AloeCooler_description: Cloyingly thick, but sweet and refreshing!
Alfajores_description: Light cookie sandwiches with dulce de leche within.
Akara_description: Fritters made of peeled beans and ground pepper.
Acorda_description: Bread porridge with a poached egg and lots of herbs.
LostPage_description: A worn out page from an old recipe book. Someone wants this back.
RecipeinaBottle_Used: You already know all bottle recipes.
RecipeinaBottle_Found: You found a 'Recipe in a Bottle'! Use this item to discover a new cooking recipe.
RecipeBook_description: A collection of recipes from a far corner of the globe.
RecipeBook_Breakfast_name: Recipe Book: Breakfast Around the World
RecipeBook_SnackFood_name: Recipe Book: Snack Food & Street Food
RecipeBook_Mountain_name: Recipe Book: Whispers of the Peaks
RecipeBook_Archipelago_name: Recipe Book: Islands of the Gem Sea
RecipeBook_Learned: You learned how to cook new recipes!
RecipeBook_Repeat: You already know the recipes in this book.
PaperHat_description: A collection of crumpled papers arranged in the approximate shape of a hat. Will you unwrap it?
CrumpledHat_description: A collection of crumpled papers arranged in the approximate shape of a hat.
QoSHat_description: How did it end up here?
ChefShop_dialogue.1: Do you have one of my missing pages? Add it to my book if you do!
ChefShop_dialogue.2: You can't find these ingredients anywhere else in the valley!
ChefShop_dialogue.3: I personally handcraft each of my recipes to ensure they always turn out perfect.
ChefShop_dialogue.4: My life philosophy: "Anyone can be a cook, if..." I'm still workshopping a second half, but maybe shorter is sweeter.
ChefShop_dialogue.5: I was quite the adventurer in my heyday. Now my old bones aren't what they used to be.
ChefShop_dialogue.6: Did you catch what was on the radio this week?
ChefShop_hint.1: I swear I saw one of my pages land around here. Let's hope it didn't end up in a tree, or worse, that some sort of woodland animal didn't take it home.
ChefShop_hint.2: I'm lucky that my travel notebook is water-resistant. Some of those pages certainly ended up floating in the water somewhere.
ChefShop_hint.3: I hope nobody else got their hands on one of my pages. It may just look like trash to them.
ChefShop_hint.4: I remember flying over a desert valley before crash-landing here. Wonder if the arid wind got hold of one of my pages?
Chef_dialogue.FoundLostPageToday: You found one of my lost pages! Give me a jiffy and I'll have that book chapter snip-snap-whipped-up and sent over to your mailbox!
Chef_dialogue.GreenRain: All my years trekking across the most remote corners of the globe, and I've never witnessed a storm like this! My word!
Chef_dialogue.Intro.a: Why, hello there! Are you one of the locals of this town?
Chef_dialogue.Intro.b: It's embarassing to admit, but I've lost a number of rather important pages around here.
Chef_dialogue.Intro.c: I'm writing a book, you see. If you help me recover the *lost pages*, I'll send you a copy of my book, free of charge!
Chef_dialogue.Intro.d: An autograph? I don't give those out easily!
Chef_dialogue.Daily.1a: How did I lose those pages, you ask? Let's just say...
Chef_dialogue.Daily.1b: ...hot air balloons are not ideal places to exchange blades.
Chef_dialogue.Daily.2a: Have you found any of my pages yet? If you have, you can add it to the book next to me. I'll mail the finished chapter to you once I can add the missing page to it.
Chef_dialogue.Daily.2b: Oh yes, I'm writing a cookbook! An encyclopedic collection of recipes from every corner of the world...it's truly my magnum opus.
Chef_dialogue.Daily.2c: Well, it will be, once it's finished of course.
Chef_dialogue.Daily.3a: Have you spoken to my traveling companion yet? It's quite kind of her to let me hitch up to her cart while I search the valley for my book pages.
Chef_dialogue.Daily.3b: Her and I go way back. Ah, but it's been many years since our travels in... well, it's not important.
Chef_dialogue.Daily.4a: I travel quite a lot for my work. One of the benefits is that I always have unique ingredients on hand!
Chef_dialogue.Daily.4b: I'm happy to part with them... for a price, of course. I've risked life and limb for some of these!
Mail_QoSBook_body: Enclosed is an advance copy of the latest chapter of my cookbook - as thanks. For your eyes only!^^Happy cooking!
ReturnPage_text: You turned in a lost page.
DuplicatePage_text: This is a duplicate page, unfortunately. Better throw it away!
CornFlour_description: A cooking ingredient made from milled corn.
WheatNoodles_description: A bundle of robust noodles used for a multitude of meals.
SeaSalt_description: A chunk of rock salt that came straight from the ocean.
Salt_description: A grinder filled with salt crystals.
Mail_AbigailRecipe_body: Hi @,^I know you're always up for trying new things, so I thought you might enjoy this recipe. I've included it below, along with some tips for making it just right. Let me know if you give it a try!^   -Abigail
Mail_AbigailTiramisu_body: What's up, @?^Something you said the other day reminded me of this. Have you ever had tiramisu before? Yeah, it's a bit too fancy for any place like the Saloon to sell it, but who's to say you can't try cooking it at home? It's so sweet and fluffy!^Besides, I heard you're a bit of a cook. If anyone can make this, I bet you can.^   -Abigail
Mail_AlexRecipe_body: @,^This recipe is a good way to stay energized and ready for anything the day can throw at you. It's one of my favorites. Hope you like it!^   -Alex
Mail_AlexOmurice_body: Hey, Farmer!^You know what I was craving this morning? A great big bowl of eggy protein.^...Okay, fine, maybe I already eat eggs every day. But check this out! It's got fried rice wrapped inside it. In fact, you should give it a try too! You gotta get stronger so I have some real competition in this town. Anyways, let's hang out tomorrow?^   -Alex
Mail_CarolineVegetablePotPie_body: Dear @,^^I hope your farm is going well! If you have any root vegetables left over, I know just the perfect recipe for them. Here are instructions for a wonderfully filling pot pie. Do give it a try sometime!^^   -Caroline
Mail_ClintTunaSteak_body: Hello...^Here's another recipe. You've been really nice to me... so... I thought you might like it. When I want to treat myself, I like to buy a fresh cut of tuna from Willy just to fry it up.^Well, take care.^   -Clint
Mail_DemetriusSeafoodBoil_body: Despite being called a 'seafood' boil, this dish actually contains multiple non-seafood ingredients. It may be more appropriate to call it a 'seafood and groundfood' boil.^This is one of my favorite childhood recipes. My thanks for all your help around the lab.^   -Demetrius
Mail_DwarfAncientWonder_body: Human, here is another message that I am entrusting to the whims of the 'postal service'.^^This very ancient recipe has been passed down by my people for millennia. It is one of the few pieces of knowledge that have survived from our ancient civilization.^^You will need some very rare ingredients in order to make this dish. But I will tell you now...it tastes incredible!^   -Dwarf
Mail_DwarfHardtack_body: Human, I have learned how to use this thing called the 'postal service' in order to 'mail' you a recipe I find most interesting. Another human taught it to me many years ago. You can bake the aboveground crop called wheat into a very hard cake that lasts for decades. And it has no flavor at all!^^Do humans like food without flavor? You should try cave carrot stew some time.^   -Dwarf
Mail_ElliottRecipe_body: @,^I hope this letter finds you well. I wanted to share a recipe for a storied meal with you. If you ever want to hear tell of it, please come talk with me again.^   -Elliott
Mail_ElliottFishnChips_body: Dearest @,^Though I love an elegant meal overlooking a serene view as much as the next refined man, sometimes there is no comparison to the greasy crunch of batter-fried fish under one's fingertips. Enclosed is a recipe I hold dear from my days of old before the valley. I greatly value your companionship and would love for you to enjoy this too. Salud,^   -Elliott
Mail_EmilyGrilledCheese_body: @!^I finally found my recipe for fool-proof grilled cheese scribbled on the back of a store receipt!^It took a bit to decipher my handwriting, but I think I got it all down. Hey, you should give this a try too! No better pick-me-up than grilled cheese with a warm bowl of tomato soup, right?^See you another day,^   -Emily
Mail_EvelynPineappleUpsideDownCake_body: Hello, dear...^^If you ever find yourself able to grow some fresh pineapples, this is one cake that is a hit with everyone! And deceptively simple, too. Although, as with any recipe, there are some details you'll want to pay special attention to... Starting with the butter, it should be creamed and not melted, 6 egg whites and 2 and a half egg yolks should be used, white sugar or brown sugar but not cane sugar...^^(**3 pages of handwritten instructions are included in this letter.)^^'Love,^Granny Evelyn'
Mail_GeorgeCheesecake_body: Well, farmer, I thought one day I may give this recipe to my grandson... but you and I both know he's not much of an ace in the kitchen! So here, maybe you'll get some use out of this. When I was younger and much more sprightly, I taught myself to bake this cake to impress a young lady in my life. And guess what... it was served at our wedding too!^   -George^^P.S. Blackberries are her favorite.
Mail_GusZucchiniFritters_body: Hi @, you're the only one I'd trust with this recipe. Yes, that's right - it's my famous zucchini fritters! ...Truth be told, you're kind of the only cooking apprentice I have. Thought I might pass this recipe onto you...not that I don't have many years left in me.^Don't forget the spicy marinara sauce, it's just as important as the fritters themselves. They sell like hotcakes every week!^   -Gus
Mail_HaleyRecipe_body: @, I found this recipe clipping in one of my magazines.^^Baking is kind of a lot of work, so why don't you make this for me instead? Emily makes us eat rabbit food every day. Something sweet would be nice.^^   -Haley
Mail_HaleySpicedCarrotCake_body: Farmer!^^I saw the *best* recipe on TV this morning. It's a Spiced Carrot Cake! But you need spice berries grown in fall, and carrots grown in spring to make it! How am I supposed to get that?^^Maybe you have these ingredients on your farm? Pleaseee can you bake one for me?^^By the way, if you become a famous chef can I take all the food photos for your top-selling cookbook? I've been practicing!^Bye~^  Haley
Mail_HarveyRecipe_body: @,^I've been thinking about you and your health and I wanted to share a recipe that I think will be good for you. I learned it from an old roommate when I was in medical school. Nutritious, and delicious too! Let me know what you think. Best,^   -Harvey
Mail_HarveyCoffeeCake_body: @,^I'll let you in on a little secret. Doctors have just as many vices as anyone else - I think you know by now that mine is coffee. Yes, high caffeine levels can have quite the adverse effect on sleep, irritability, blood pressure, anxiety, bowel movements, heart palpitations, and more... Well, that's why I try not to have too many of these. But it's a siren's song...^   -Harvey
Mail_JasStrawberryShortcake_body: Dear ${Mr.^Ms.}$ @,^When I was four my mom baked me a cake like this for my birthday. That was SOOO long ago. I fownd this recipe in Aunt Marnie's book but I'm too young to use the oven by myself. Can you prety please make this for me? Love,^   -Jas
Mail_JodiHeartySautee_body: Dear @,^Are you getting enough vitamins? Hehe!^^I've got just the little recipe for you. Some sliced bell peppers, mushrooms, radish together with an onion and some herbs to spice it up, and you'll have a delicious side dish for any dinner! Even my boys will eat it, and they usually hate eating their vegetables!^^I'm sure the ingredients will be no problem for you to gather.^^Love,^   -Jodi
Mail_KentJohnnycakes_body: Here... an old recipe from my days training as a young recruit. Simple, but reminds me of better times... goofing around with the platoon, playing cards in the canteen...^^Sometimes you just gotta hold onto the memories. Don't let the present make you forget your past, @.^^    -Kent
Mail_KrobusCritterFritter_body: @, I have gotten help to send this letter so that I can share this tasty snack with you. My people like to fry these up for big occasions, especially during the Festival of the Mundane. It's a most delicious snack.^^Make sure to choose big grubs.^^   -Krobus
Mail_KrobusAntsonaLog_body: Greetings @,^I have been curious about human food for quite some time. Your kind often talk about the taste and texture of various dishes, but to me, it all sounds like a foreign language. Please find a recipe enclosed and share it with me. I would like to experience this tasty morsel.^    -Krobus
Mail_LeahRecipe_body: Dear @,^I find inspiration in all sorts of places, including in the kitchen. Cooking and baking can be just as creative as painting or sculpting, and I love experimenting with new recipes and flavors. I thought I would share my latest creation with you.^    -Leah
Mail_LeahBroccoliandCheese_body: Dear @,^My mother's recipe. I was fortunate to grow up in a house with a garden - at the end of fall, I'd pick wild broccolinis for us to bake in the oven. Only needs some grated cheese, and salt and pepper to taste, but if you add breadcrumbs on top, it's even more delicious!^Some people like to go heavy with the cheese, but I say the broccoli is what carries all the flavor.^   -Leah
Mail_MarnieCastella_body: Dear @,^It feels like it's been so long since you moved to the valley. Don't you think so? Well, you've really become part of the family here. I mean, just look at how happy the cows are when you're around!^I have a recipe for the most wonderfully fluffy sponge cake that you can make with fresh milk. There's no frosting, so the natural sweetness of the milk will really come through in this one.^    -Marnie
Mail_MaruRecipe_body: @,^What's up? Lately, I've been reading about food from all around the world. How do you think people from centuries ago even came up with some of this? They must have had to go through a lot of trial and error.^Here's a recipe I saw that reminded me of you.^    -Maru
Mail_MaruCrabRangoons_body: @,^I've made a breakthrough! This might be the best recipe yet. It's apparently a popular fusion food, and I've found the perfect parameters to replicate it! Crispy, crunchy deep-fried shell with creamy, crabby, cheesy insides! You have got to try this!^   -Maru
Mail_PamStuffedMushrooms_body: Hey kid, you're a good egg. What, can't a gal like me send a nice letter once in a while?^^Meh, thought you'd be interested in this mushroom recipe. It's just a scrap piece of paper for me.^   -Pam
Mail_PennyRecipe_body: I hope you've been taking care. I was going through my recipe box the other day and I found an old family recipe that I think you're going to love. Please enjoy it when you have the time.^    -Penny
Mail_PennyGingersnaps_body: @,^Since I was a little girl, I've always loved baking. My mom's kitchen may be a little cramped, but I always made it work with whatever we had on hand.^^This was the first recipe that I ever learned how to cook. It was really special, because we had just gotten some fresh ginger from a family friend. I was covered in flour from head to toe by the time I was done! But my mom was so proud of me.^^Love,^Penny
Mail_PierreMotleyMushrooms_body: TOP SECRET:^This one is brand new with truffle oil straight from my personal stock. Don't share it around! I'm giving it to you because we are such good friends.^    -Pierre
Mail_RobinPotatoBread_body: Dear @,^I wanted to send you this old recipe that's been in my family for generations. It's a regional specialty! You don't need any fancy five-course meal to keep you fed while woodworking all day - one loaf of this filling potato bread gives you all the energy you need. And only one ingredient: potatoes!^   -Robin
Mail_SamRecipe_body: @,^How have you been lately? Here's something I make all the time for an afternoon snack. It's killer! Let me know what you think. And if you ever need any more recipe ideas, hit me up.^   -Sam
Mail_SamDonut_body: @,^It's a donut. What more can I say?^Not but for real, you've been an amazing friend to me. Just wanted to return some of that energy. Catch ya later,^   -Sam
Mail_SebastianRecipe_body: Hey @,^Well, you're one of the few people in this town who doesn't talk to me like I'm a freak. Have a recipe I found, I guess. I'm not much of a cook, so...farmers like cooking, right?^   -Sebastian
Mail_SebastianFancySushiPlatter_body: Hi @,^^Sometimes, I wish this valley had a real high-end restaurant nearby. Someone I know online was telling me about the crazy types of fish that people eat raw - like poisonous pufferfish and sea urchins. Wild, right?^^I have to try that some day. If you catch a good pufferfish, make sure to let me try some - though, maybe you should be the one to taste-test it for poison first.^^Just kidding, lol.^   -Sebastian
Mail_ShanePineapplePizza_body: @,^Pineapple on pizza: is it a crime against food?^^ Heh... I know you've got a sense of humor. That's why we get along. Honestly, I think pineapple pizza is great, just like any other pizza. Don't really know why other people make such a fuss.^^I won't be hurt if you don't like this recipe though.^   -Shane
Mail_VincentAnimalCrackers_body: Dear ${Mr.^Ms.}$ @,^This is my faverit snack ever! My familee ate it wen we went to the zoo. I love the zoo! Espeshully the lionz.^Okay! Love,^   -Vincent
Mail_WillyOysterSauceCrab_body: Dear @,^Crabs are snappin' this season! My ol' pops always said you can't teach a crab to walk straight... What that means, I got no dang clue! But you sure can turn them into a mean seafood fry.^You also need to make oyster sauce fer this thing, so here's a recipe for that too.^Happy crabbin'!^   -Willy
Mail_WizardRainbowCake_body: Dear @,^I wanted to share with you a recipe that can be quite useful in your magical studies. The ingredients for this recipe may be difficult to obtain, but you'll find that the benefits are more than worth the effort.^   -M. Rasmodius, Wizard
WizardNote: Still fruitlessly searching for the dish known to Smoluanu as the 'Ancient Wonder'... Whoever brings me proof of this mysterious food should be handsomely rewarded with arcane knowledge.^^M. Rasmodius.
WizardQuest_description: The Wizard is searching for a dwarven recipe only known as 'Ancient Wonder'. Perhaps you could get on his good side if you found it for him.
WizardQuest_objective: Deliver an 'Ancient Wonder' to the Wizard.
WizardQuest_dialogue1: That hue... that aroma... that power... Could it be...?
WizardQuest_dialogue2: It is! The elusive 'Ancient Wonder'! I sense immense magical potential emanating from this dish!
WizardQuest_dialogue3: You've earned yourself a place in my book. Here's the recipe for a potent concoction made from obscure ingredients...only a true mage can wield this.
WizardQuest_dialogue4: Now, leave me to my devices...I must examine this 'wonder' myself...
Elliott_dialogue.default.intro: Ah, @, I see you've been charmed by the recipe I sent you. How wonderful! The aroma of this recalls to mind...
Elliott_dialogue.default.end: My thanks for the fond memory, @, you're an inspiration as always. Hmm... I must write the rest of this idea down before it escapes me...
Elliott_dialogue.CremeBrulee.1: ...the taste of the most divine of desserts I have had! The patissier who prepared it for me had inherited the recipe passed down through generations past.
Elliott_dialogue.CremeBrulee.2: This family's tradition was kept alive by a single, golden, vanilla bean plant. The location of which was a fiercely guarded secret, of course.
Elliott_dialogue.CremeBrulee.3: I see your own vanilla beans are delectable as well!
Elliott_dialogue.ChefSalad.1: ...My brief stay in a tiny mountain cottage, fresh herbs drying in the windows. The homesteader invites a famished traveler in for a plate of hand-picked garden greens...
Elliott_dialogue.ChefSalad.2: ...I remember now the personal flair of the dish, boiled eggs cut into the shapes of stars, dotting nature's canvas...
Elliott_dialogue.FigToast.1: ..A garden hemmed by the marble ruins of a society long gone, told only by the unmoving statues of forgotten gods and goddesses.
Elliott_dialogue.FigToast.2: The decadent figs hung heavy from a tree in the center of that courtyard, said to be a cursed lover of one of those wily and impulsive dieties. An enrapturing legend, for sure!
Elliott_dialogue.FishnChips.1: Does my nose deceive me...fish and chips! And warm from the pan, as well! *crunch*
Elliott_dialogue.FishnChips.2: I'll confess the truth to you, @. This is quite a special dish for me. You see, it was the first truly homely meal I was able to experience in my life.
Elliott_dialogue.FishnChips.3: That day I picked up the quill and set out into the world for good...I walked for hours, not knowing where my feet were leading me.
Elliott_dialogue.FishnChips.4: Until I found myself on a cobblestone pier, at the very edge of a town I'd never been to. I never thought I'd ever eat something so deep-fried and material as fish and chips, but that day, it was the best thing I'd ever tasted.
Elliott_dialogue.FishnChips.5: Thank you for the reminder of that wonderful experience, @. You've given me a lot to ponder on.
QoSRadio_description: A radio that broadcasts new cooking lessons from the queen of sauce every week. Currently airing on Tuesdays and Saturdays.
RecipeBook_SweetSensations_description: Learn all Queen Of Sauce recipes from the Sweet Sensations radio broadcast.
RecipeBook_AroundTheWorld_name: Queen Of Sauce - Around The World
RecipeBook_AroundTheWorld_description: Learn all Queen Of Sauce recipes from the Around The World radio broadcast.
Mail_QoSRadio_body: Dear Mr. John Smith,^^CONGRATULATIONS!!^^on winning our sweepstakes for dedicated GFBN viewers! Enclosed is one of our limited edition countertop radios, which can be used to listen to exclusive Queen of Sauce broadcasts from the comfort of your own home. Tune in every week on Tuesday and Saturday to catch a brand new recipe!^   -The Greater Ferngill Broadcasting Network... brought to you, by viewers like you. Thank you!
Radio_IntroAroundTheWorld: Greetings! It is I, the queen of sauce - on air! Join me today as we discover a new mouth-watering recipe from around the world. This week's dish...
Radio_IntroSweetSensations: Greetings! It is I, the queen of sauce - on air! Join me today as we discover a delectable new dessert to make your day. This week's creation...
Radio_NothingToday: There is nothing on the radio today.
Radio_Eclair: Éclair! The choux pastry is light and airy, the filling adds a luxurious creaminess, and the glossy chocolate glaze tops it off with the perfect touch of sweetness! We'll be making a classic éclair today, but you can experiment to your taste with different flavors and fillings. Let's get ready with...
Radio_FruitTurnover: Fruit Turnover! I'm immediately greeted by the irresistible aroma of spring, flaky pie dough around a sweet and tangy fruit filling, and a dash of lemon to spruce it up. They're perfect for breakfast, brunch, or dessert, and they're sure to disappear quickly once they hit the table. Slice your favorite fruit and...
Radio_MudPie: Mud Pie! Despite its name, there is no mud involved in this recipe, trust me. This is a rich dessert perfect for chocolate lovers out there: brownie, chocolate, and whipped cream coming together to create this beautiful, creamy pie. Let’s start by making the brownie batter...
Radio_LemonSquare: Lemon Squares! Oh, sweet summer delight... The first time I had a lemon square, it was like someone squeezed a whole golden afternoon into a single bite. Tender shortbread crust, and so much lemon flavor... Ooh! Tart enough to make your eyebrows raise, sweet enough to make you forgive it. Let's set out with our lemon curd...
Radio_Ambrosia: Ambrosia! As I take a spoonful of ambrosia, I'm immediately struck by the burst of flavors and textures. The juicy sweetness of the fruit, the creamy richness of the whipped cream, and the crunch of the nuts all come together in perfect harmony. You can use any combination of fruit you like...
Radio_Pavlova: Pavlova! Supposedly it's named after the light, airy dancing of a ballerina. The desert consists of a crisp meringue shell with a soft, marshmallow-like center, topped with whipped cream and fresh fruit. It's the perfect dessert for a warm summer day. Let's begin...
Radio_CalicoBar: Calico Bar! These decadent bars consist of three layers: a crumbly, coconut and nut base, a creamy custard-flavored filling, and a rich chocolate topping. The buttery base provides a perfect contrast to the creamy filling, while the rich chocolate topping adds a satisfying finish. Start with your custard filling...
Radio_Millefeuille: Mille-feuille! Despite its 'million' layers, it’s not fussy; it’s precise. It’s the kind of dessert that rewards patience, celebrates craftsmanship, and says, 'You deserve something beautiful today.' Layers of flaky pastry and cream, so smooth, so rich. And the top? That signature glaze, striped with chocolate, dragged into that iconic feathered pattern with the tip of a knife...
Radio_CinnamonApplePie: Cinnamon Apple Pie! A good Cinnamon Apple Pie is all about balance. The filling should have just enough tartness to make the sweetness sing. You want the apples tender but not mushy. And cinnamon... oh, cinnamon is the old friend that makes it all feel right. Some folks like a hint of nutmeg or a whisper of clove; I say trust your nose. If it smells like home, it’s probably perfect...
Radio_CrumbCake: Crumb Cake! Crumb cake, also known as coffee cake, is a moist and tender cake topped with a generous layer of buttery, cinnamon-scented crumbs. This beloved comfort food is often enjoyed alongside a cup of coffee or tea. Preheat your oven to...
Radio_Sopapillas: Sopapillas! Sopapillas are light and fluffy fried pastries made from dough rolled out and cut into squares or triangles. They're then deep-fried until golden brown and puffing up, resulting in a crispy exterior and a soft, pillowy interior. Eat them with honey! First, get your flour...
Radio_PrincessCake: Princess Cake! This is indeed a cake made for royalty! Soft cake, filled with layers of rich, sweet jam. And the best part? The marzipan! This almond fondant is like a cherry on top, adding even more flavor to what was an already remarkable dish. We start by making our very own jam…
Radio_Cannoli: Cannoli! With cannolo - which is how we refer to just one - the shell is everything. It should snap, it should shatter. None of this soft nonsense! 'A soggy cannoli is a broken promise,' I had someone once tell me. So let's start with the promise of wonderfully crisp cannoli...
Radio_KingCake: King Cake! A sugary symbol of celebration and chaos like no other. Because inside this sweet spiral of brioche and glaze? There’s a baby. And if you find it, guess what? You’re baking the next one. Or hosting the next party. Or both! Luckily, the baby isn't real! But is there another secret inside...? Let's find out...
Radio_Jalebi: Jalebi! Today’s treat is an absolute swirl of joy. Jalebi is pure drama in dessert form: bright orange, sizzling in hot oil, then dunked in sugar syrup until every curve is lacquered in gloss. It crackles in your hand and melts on your tongue, with no apology for the sweetness it owns. First, let's get together our ingredients...
Radio_UbeHalaya: Ube Halaya! Mashed ube, or purple yams, cooked slowly in coconut milk until they've been tamed into a creamy, slightly sticky treat with a faintly nutty flavor and a mellow sweetness. This dessert has such a gorgeous color that it looks like it comes straight from a fairy tale! Gather your friends and family and take turns mashing ube together...
Radio_Churros: Churros! The crunch! That thin, delicate armor of crisp dough giving way to a soft center. Rolled in cinnamon sugar while still hot, just enough to make your fingers sticky and your heart flutter. The kind of sweetness that demands a moment of silence...
Radio_Daifuku: Daifuku! The mochi is so soft and delicate, it practically melts in your mouth, and the sweet filling is just the right amount of sweetness to balance out the chewiness of the mochi. No matter what flavor you choose, the experience of eating daifuku is always a delight. You really have to try for yourself to understand...
Radio_Souffle: Soufflé! This airy creation is the perfect marriage of art and science, relying on whipped egg whites to lift the batter into a delicate, cloud-like rise in the oven. Soufflés can be sweet or savory, but the dessert version is pure elegance, best enjoyed the instant it emerges from the oven. Sweet soufflé begins with...
Radio_Mooncake: Mooncake! Ahhh... mooncakes. They're not casual, they’re ceremonial. They arrive with lanterns, laughter, poetry, and the hush of autumn evenings. A round pastry, dense with history and hope, exchanged during nighttime festivals, when the moon is full and hearts are too. To begin, let's make the mild but sweet filling...
Radio_GotoroCream: Gotoro Cream! Gotoro cream doesn't clamor for your attention... it enchants you. Made with rich custard lightened by whipped cream and set just enough to hold its shape. And the flavor? Imagine vanilla at its most intimate. Sometimes there’s a whisper of fruit, but the cream is always the heart. To begin, pour a generous amount of...
Radio_PineappleCake: Pineapple Cake! Some people do not enjoy sour fruit in their desserts, which is a shame. The tartness of the pineapple brings out the best in this fluffy cake, and the sweetness of the cake helps break the acidity that can sometimes be a deal breaker for many people. One of my personal favorites! Make sure to use a ripe pineapple...
Radio_MascarponeLuxury: Mascarpone Luxury! Today, dear chefs, we're not baking, we're swooning. Folded into cloud-like frostings, dolloped onto roasted figs, whisked into sauces, spread on warm bread, or simply layered with sweet fruit in a delightfully small glass... Next time you're tempted to reach for cream cheese or butter: pause. Consider mascarpone. Let's start with treating ourselves to...
Radio_Sachertorte: Sachertorte! The rich and moist chocolate cake is perfectly complemented by jam and a chocolate glaze. The combination of flavors is simply heavenly. Sachertorte is a dessert that's perfect for a special occasion or as a sweet indulgence. Try it in the next café you go to with a cup of coffee! Let's begin...
Radio_GulabJamun: Gulab Jamun! This royal treat is the celebrated darling of every festival, every wedding feast, every fête! Plump little balls of milk doughs fried ever so gently until they're the color of autumn leaves. And then... they're bathed in a fragrant syrup of cardamom, rose water, and saffron. The result? Heavenly little suns, syrup-soaked to the core. Measure out a your milk powder...
Radio_Horchata: Horchata! A sweet and creamy drink made from a blend of rice, almonds, cinnamon, and sugar. It's often served cold over ice and enjoyed as a refreshing treat on a hot day. Some people even like adding vanilla for a bit of extra flavor! Start by putting rice in a blender and...
Radio_Trifle: Trifle! Look close. No, closer. Closer! The secret to this dessert is the layers of delight. Spongy cake, silky custard, fresh jam, billows of whipped cream, all crowned with a jeweled array of fruit garnishes. How you layer it is up to you, as every layer need have only one purpose: is it delicious to eat? Anything else, it's just a trifle. Arrange your ingredients and bowl and...
Radio_StickyToffeePudding: Sticky Toffee Pudding! What looks like a simple cake topped with ice cream is not that simple. Once baked, the cake is drenched generously in a warm, buttery toffee sauce, turning it into a rich, sticky, gooey joy. Serve with a dollop of vanilla ice cream! Set your oven to...
Radio_Baumkuchen: Baumkuchen! Today, we take a spin, quite literally, through the many golden layers of this iconic cake. Each layer is carefully baked one at a time on a rotating spit over open flame, so that when you slice into it, it looks like the cross-section of a tree. Start this hypnotic dessert by preheating your oven...
Radio_RollCake: Roll Cake! This one is a childhood classic. It can be a tricky one, as the batter must bake out perfectly so it doesn't break when we roll it into perfect circles. Pay attention to all the steps and you should come out with the creamiest, fluffiest roll cake. We begin with the filling...
Radio_TresLechesCake: Tres Leches Cake! Like eating a cloud that stopped by a dairy farm on its way here. Light, creamy, and just a little bit indulgent, tres leches cake is made with a light sponge cake which has absorbed and soaked three forms of milk: evaporated, condensed, and fresh cream. That's the 'tres'! Start by lining up your milk ingredients...
Radio_Yatsuhashi: Yatsuhashi! This traditional wagashi has been delighting palates for centuries, especially as a souvenir from the old traditional towns. It's a light, airy mochi filled with a sweet, chewy filling. While the traditional filling is cinnamon, red bean paste and matcha are also popular flavors! Let's start with some rice...
Radio_PepperSoup: Pepper Soup! A spicy and bright personality, this clear broth is filled with wonderfully fresh fish and a unique underlayer of nutmeg which brings to the table a dance all its own. Pepper soup is deceptively simple, but don't let the clarity fool you. Each sip warms the soul, tingles the tongue, and spreads a gentle fire down to your toes. Start by scaling a fat tiger trout...
Radio_EggTarts: Egg Tarts! This buttery pastry is certainly a globe-trotter. Whether you favor the blister-topped pastel de nata straight from monasteries, the delightful dim sum treat from tea houses along historic trade routes, or the quick and easy variety from the street food capital of the world, egg tarts have a instance that will please everyone. Take eggs and...
Radio_CabbageRoll: Cabbage Roll! A bundle of humble yet hearty comfort food wrapped in nature’s own packaging. Everyone's grandmama has a different recipe for the filling, but one staple is the savory tomato-based sauce that these little swaddles are drenched in. First, chop fresh tomatoes...
Radio_CacioePepe: Cacio e Pepe! This dish only requires a few ingredients, but it's packed with flavor. The cheese and pepper create a sparky and creamy sauce that coats every strand of the spaghetti perfectly. For such a simple dish, it certainly represents the king of pasta. Start by bringing water to a boil...
Radio_ThreeSistersSalad: Three Sisters Salad! The 'three sisters' in this salad refer to corn, beans, and squash. In some parts of the world, these three crops have been grown together for centuries because they work with one another in the field. Just as the tall corn stalks stand strong to support the growth of beans under them, they'll also create a wonderful base for this flavorful and varied dish...
Radio_Japchae: Japchae! At the heart of this dish are the clear, glossy glass noodles which carry sweet and savory in every bite. Fresh vegetables bring a bright crunch to this bowl of refined comfort. Soak your noodles in...
Radio_Samosas: Samosas! Little pockets of fragrant happiness wrapped in golden pastry, begging to be devoured. Potatoes, lentils, and peas all mingle with the spice of coriander and cumin. Serve them with a mint sauce, or perhaps a mango-tamarind chutney if you lean to the adventurous side! To start, take flour and...
Radio_Borsch: Borsch! Just saying the name feels like a hug in a bowl. I first tasted it in a small village, on a winter morning so crisp the frost sparkled on the windows, and the earthy aroma of simmering beets, cabbage, and herbs wrapped around me like a woolen scarf. Every spoonful carries the soft warmth of slow-cooked richness with a gentle lift of acidity. It all starts with the brightest beets you can find...
Radio_GalloPinto: Gallo Pinto! A simple yet brilliant marriage of rice and black beans, stir-fried with onions, peppers, and a touch of cilantro, often kissed with traditional salsa. Earthy, smoky, and slightly tangy, with each bite carrying a subtle harmony that makes your mouth want to keep moving. There’s a rhythm to it...
Radio_OneManThousand: One Man Thousand! Just the name makes you curious, doesn't it? I first heard of it from a market stall, where the vendor laughed as he handed me a plate. “You'll see,” he said, “one man, a thousand flavors.” And he wasn't wrong. A thousand small fish fried to crispy perfection in a spicy coating such that you could eat them by the spoonful. And oh boy, will you eat them by the spoonful...
Radio_PanikiStew: Paniki Stew! I stumbled upon this in the high mountains of the tropics, where the smoke from clay stoves mingled with the scent of lemongrass and chilies. Though a gamey meat, the fruit bat's diet imparts an interestingly sweet flavor when cooked, brought out by the rich, spiced coconut milk broth. Don't turn your nose up, and give this dish a go with...
Radio_Blini: Blini! Blini are delicate, tender pancakes, made with a slightly sweet, yeasted batter that puffs gently in the pan. The buckwheat flour in this recipe adds a lovely nutty depth. Top them with sour cream or cream cheese, and for a real pinkies up moment, fresh caviar. Let's make our batter and preheat our pan...
Radio_BlackenedFish: Blackened Fish! This fish isn't shy. This fish is a fish which knows how to *sing*. Coated in a bold blend of paprika, cayenne, garlic, thyme, oregano, and a little black pepper, then seared in a *blistering hot* cast-iron pan. Hear that? That's the fish singing! The spices crisp up on the outside while the fish stays light and flakey in a combination that is just... mmwah!...
Radio_SeafoodPaella: Seafood Paella! This here is a special request from a longtime listener by the name of Gus, who tried my paella once and simply could not get enough. Once you make it too, you'll see why! Rice infused with a rich seafood stock, and saffron to give it that warm golden glow. And then, a crispy caramelized layer of treasure hiding beneath the golden surface... This is celebration in a pan!...
Radio_Bannock: Bannock! I remember first tasting this in a small camp on the plains, sitting by a fire as the sun slipped behind the hills, the air full of smoke, stories, and laughter. This humble bread carries the history of countless communities, each with their own way of making it. Start by making a dough of flour and water...
Radio_VegetableKorma: Vegetable Korma! Tender vegetables like carrots, potatoes, or cauliflower are simmered in a rich curry made from yogurt. There are so many different spins on this particular curry, that the recipe ends up just being and expression of *you* in the end! Coarsely chop your favorite vegetables...
Radio_Bibimbap: Bibimbap! Bibimbap literally means “mixed rice,” but it’s so much more than just rice. There’s a little bit of everything: crisp, sautéed vegetables, tender sprouts, earthy mushrooms, juicy zucchini, and a perfectly fried sunny-side-up egg perched on top, ready to mingle with the other flavors. And don't forget the gochujang! Rinse rice and...
Radio_OdenHotpot: Oden Hotpot! For me, oden is a dish that brings back fond memories of my travels abroad. I remember walking through the streets on a cold winter evening, and the smell of the savory broth wafting through the air drew me to a street vendor selling oden. I ordered a bowl and was instantly hooked by the heartiness and warmth of the dish...
Radio_Fufu: Fufu! You'll certainly get a workout pounding this cassava into an elastic and filling dough. It’s always eaten with your hands, often dipped into richly flavored soups or stews carrying bold, spicy, and savory flavors. When making fufu, you'll need to be sure to properly prepare the cassava to remove any toxins, so grab a bowl of water...
Radio_MisoRamen: Miso Ramen! Ohh... a nice hot bowl of miso ramen! The broth is rich and hearty, fermented miso giving it that signature umami depth. Of course, we'll be finishing it with a melty-gooey egg and leafy veggies, but the real star here is the broth, and you should never overpower it with a pile of toppings! We'll start with our broth today by...
Radio_NasiGoreng: Nasi Goreng! Imagine a perfect pile of fried rice glistening, flecked with vibrant bits of vegetables, perhaps some cuts of tender chicken, and a fried egg on top, yolk just begging to break and run through the dish. Nasi goreng is the king of flavor and of fried rice! Though there are so many variants of fried rice, none compare to nasi goreng made on an open flame with a large wok. Take day old rice to begin and...
Radio_Laghman: Laghman! Thick, hand-pulled noodles serve as the base, with fresh eggplant refusing to play second fiddle to the pepper it shares the bowl with. Garlic, chili, and fermented soy paste add depth and umami that warms you from the inside out. Eating laghman feels like hugging the mountains themselves. So pull out your pasta maker...
Radio_Inarizushi: Inarizushi! A type of sushi that's made with saké seasoned rice stuffed inside a sweet and crispy pouch made of deep-fried tofu. A deeply traditional food that's thought to be the favorite of certain regional harvest goddesses. It's a unique and delicious dish that's great to make ahead of time and pack for a picnic or lunch. Start with rice...
Radio_Namul: Namul! Namul is not so much a dish on its own, as it is a collection of sensations best had in small bites. Lightly blanched or sautéed greens such as spinach, fernbrake, or bean sprouts, tossed with sesame oil, garlic, sesame seeds, and a splash of soy. A hint of chili, a dash of bean paste; no two namul presentations are the same...
Radio_Lutefisk: Lutefisk! This ages-old preserved fish dish is served aside potatoes and peas to make a wonderfully filling meal for the dead of winter. Of course, homemade lutefisk is the best, but if you don't have the time to soak a fish in lye for two weeks, then store bought is fine. Just be sure to warn your housemates, neighbors, and neighbor's neighbors...
Radio_Ceviche: Ceviche! A seafood dish made with raw fish that's been marinated in citrus juices, herbs, and spices. The acid from the citrus juices actually 'cooks' the fish, giving it a slightly firm texture and a tangy flavor. There's nothing quite like the blend of tart lime infused fish, crunchy onion, and creamy avocado. Let's get chopping...
Radio_LechedeLeon: Leche de Leon! Listeners who tuned in last week will remember our recipe for ceviche... but did you know you can also use the same ingredients to make a refreshing, spicy, fishy drink? Don't knock it till you try it! The most important ingredient is a large, freshly-caught lionfish...
Radio_Mohinga: Mohinga! Rich, fragrant catfish soup garnished with fresh shallots and a squeeze of lime to brighten it up. The base is a tangy fish broth, often thickened with ground rice, and spiced with turmeric, ginger, and a touch of chili. I just can't get enough of this dish, it tastes like a bowl of a home I've never known! Let's start by making the broth...
Radio_Zarusoba: Zarusoba! A cold noodle dish that's perfect for spring, which consists of soba - or buckwheat - noodles, and a savory dipping sauce. The green onions and ginger add a fresh and slightly spicy kick, while the wasabi adds a unique heat that lingers on the tongue. Let's begin...
Radio_LotusWrappedStickyRice: Lotus Wrapped Sticky Rice! This wonderful parcel of chewy rice and savory mushrooms has such an addicting fragrance from the lotus leaves used to wrap it. You can't skip the leaf wrap, it truly brings this bundle of treasure to the next level! We'll cook it all together in a steamer basket, so what you'll need is...
Radio_GreenFigandSaltfish: Green Fig and Saltfish!  From sun-soaked beaches where steel drums ring lightly in the background, green fig and saltfish is a celebration of contrast. Dried and salted cod balances perfectly with the sweet but unripe plantain. Seasoned to perfection with garlic, it's a burst of flavor. Start by prepping your lingcod...
Radio_FishAmok: Fish Amok! This curry is a delight for the senses. The aroma of lemongrass and coconut milk wafts through the air, enticing you to take a bite. The creamy texture of the coconut milk and the soft, tender chunks of fish make for a comforting and satisfying meal. First, we'll need to prepare a banana leaf basket...
RecipeBook_Breakfast_Page1: 'Breakfast, the most important meal of the day! These energy-rich dishes are sure to get your morning started off on the right foot, no matter where you are in the world.'
RecipeBook_Breakfast_Page2: 'Want a sugary treat to get you going, or maybe a simpler meal of grains and eggs? Will you pour a cup of freshly squeezed citrus, or a mug of the darkest roast coffee? Find enticing notes, both written and scented, within!'
RecipeBook_Northern_Page1: 'At the end of every farming season comes a winter of rest. And for the people of the great north, the winter is long indeed. Dried, smoked, and pickled; food here takes all sorts of forms to last through the frigid cold.'
RecipeBook_Northern_Page2: 'Oh, but when spring breaks once more, the harvest is plentiful indeed and golden grain sprouts up to offer its bounty... Now, come make one of these hearty stews, and you'll be dreaming about the aurora borealis!'
RecipeBook_Dessert_Page1: 'Perfect pointed peaks of meringue, the sweet explosion of ripe strawberries, soft dustings of powdered sugar, or the deep aroma of nutty chocolates, ahhhhh... My friends, there is nothing quite like sinking into the warm embrace of a dessert.'
RecipeBook_Dessert_Page2: 'The true meaning of dessert isn't that it's sweet, or sour, or bitter... it's that it's the final piece, the little bit that you indulge to cap off the most wonderful adventure of a meal. When you look back on any one of these recipes, you'll think, 'What a delight, the perfect last bite!''
RecipeBook_ComfortFood_Page1: 'Picture a lazy summer afternoon, wiping off sweat and grass stains left from a neighborhood game of catch. Your granny calls you from a distance—supper is ready! And the table is laden with all of your favorites.'
RecipeBook_ComfortFood_Page2: 'When we say 'comfort food', we're talking about memories, food that takes you back in time and makes you feel warm and secure again. These dishes may fill your stomach easily, but what they truly fill the best is your soul.'
RecipeBook_SnackFood_Page1: 'If you're a true aficionado, you'll know — there's no king of culinary travel quite like that of a locale's street food! Sizzling oil in flaming-hot woks, the shouts of hawkers up and down the alley...'
RecipeBook_SnackFood_Page2: '...the press of shoulder-to-shoulder foot traffic under the lights of the night market...street food is truly individual! So order up some tasty skewers, grab a cup of freshly squeezed cane juice, and sink your teeth into some of these recipes!'
RecipeBook_Woodland_Page1: 'One of my favorite ventures! Imagine a fog-drenched forest studded with the ingredients of nature's bounty... Berries, fiddleheads, wild rice and corn, carefully tended to for generations.'
RecipeBook_Woodland_Page2: 'Whether one is roasting the day's catch on the warm village hearth, or chasing an airy arepa with a glass of sparkling strawberry juice, there is delight to be found in natural, hearty flavors foraged straight from the earth...'
RecipeBook_Highland_Page1: 'One could spend hours discussing the cities and states of the high- and lowlands! Each hamlet and village comes with its own unique flavor. Truffles and pasta along sun-bathed streets in old wine country, espresso in countryside cafes...'
RecipeBook_Highland_Page2: '...the salted scent of the white sandy coast, or haute cuisine in the City of Lights—all will amaze! Hold onto your tastebuds, because not a single dish in this collection will leave you disappointed...'
RecipeBook_Archipelago_Page1: 'You can't fancy yourself a globetrotter until you go island-hopping in the tropics of the Gem Sea, savoring all on offer. Come dock your ship at the low atolls, where people salt dry fish on wicker frames above lapping waves.'
RecipeBook_Archipelago_Page2: 'Then, join me in the tropical jungles between dormant volcanoes, where spice and citrus tingle on the tip of your tongue! Each island is home to a different cuisine, but they're all bound by one key element, the sea—so get ready to sink or swim!'
RecipeBook_Savanna_Page1: 'The pounding of mallets beating dough slowly dwindles, replaced by the chattering of hungry townsfolk. As firelight rises, camp cooks bring out platters piled with mounds of fufu, bowls of chunky soups, and sun-dried crawfish...'
RecipeBook_Savanna_Page2: '...Meals are best when you've helped in their making, and in this warm land, helping is not a chore, but a connection to friends and family. So share in this feeling, warm as the sunset in your belly!'
RecipeBook_InlandSea_Page1: 'The Crescent Sea... A region synonymous with the very advent of agriculture! From the nexus of this small region spread a wildfire of flavor around the world. Every village and town carries with them a history and twist to the flavors found here.'
RecipeBook_InlandSea_Page2: 'No two soups or curries or salads or breads here are quite the same. Tear open a coal-baked flatbread to eat with any of these zesty meals, and never forget that this is where the idea of *cuisine* was born!'
RecipeBook_Delta_Page1: 'Thousands of rowboats traverse this network of rivers every day, carrying an incredible bounty of handpicked fruit, aromatic herbs, and desserts from all over the region. A flavorful meal is never more than a hand's wave away!'
RecipeBook_Delta_Page2: 'Dishes from this region favor noodles and stir fries—and of course, don't forget the pepper. Rice grows especially well in the floodplains here, so get your cooking pot ready...'
RecipeBook_Mountain_Page1: 'When I first ferried to the whispering lands, my expectations were blown out of the water. A peninsula dotted with fishing villages and an island chain wrested up out of the sea, with snow-capped mountains connected by winding footpaths.'
RecipeBook_Mountain_Page2: 'And the food... the food! Some favor a spice so sharp it will burn you, some favor a sour pickle fermented for months with so much bite you think you might pucker inside out. Any everywhere, the freshest fish one could ask for, caught that morning!'
Mail_GusEventOne_body: @,^I'm setting up a regular cooking lesson at the saloon, to try and get townspeople more interested in a variety of cuisines. If you're free tonight, come stop by!^     -Gus
Mail_GusEventOne_title: Gus's Cooking Invitation: Pesto and Garlic
Mail_GusEventTwo_body: @,^Last week's cooking lesson was a success! There'll be another one tonight at the saloon, if you have time. Hope to see you there!^     -Your friend, Gus
Mail_GusEventThree_body: @,^Glad to have you at the cooking lessons, as always. If you have time tonight, there'll be another. Can't wait to show you some of these spices!^     -Your friend, Gus
Mail_GusEventThree_title: Gus's Cooking Invitation: Cumin and Cilantro
Mail_GusEventFour_body: @,^As always, there's going to be another cooking lesson at the saloon tonight.^I've been sending out letters to everyone, but I'm not sure they're getting them! Hah!^     -Your friend, Gus
Mail_GusEventFive_body: Glad as always to be able to have you over to the cooking lessons, @. There'll be another one tonight, if you have the time. Though to tell the truth, it may be the last one.^     -Your friend, Gus
Mail_GusEventFive_title: Gus's Cooking Invitation: Spice to Taste
Events_GarlicPesto_dialogue.Gus.1b: I'm excited to start expanding the depth and profile of everyone's cooking.
Events_GarlicPesto_dialogue.Gus.1c: Today we're going to cover one of my favorite flavors: garlic.
Events_GarlicPesto_dialogue.Gus.1d: Garlic is often considered an essential aromatic ingredient for starting so many different kinds of dishes.
Events_GarlicPesto_dialogue.Gus.1e: I also wanted to introduce an herby accompaniment for it called pesto.
Events_GarlicPesto_dialogue.Gus.1f: Does anyone have any questions so far?
Events_GarlicPesto_dialogue.Caroline.2a: Which herbs are included in pesto...? It smells a bit like the herbs in my garden.
Events_GarlicPesto_dialogue.Gus.3b: The main ingredients in pesto are actually pine nuts and basil!
Events_GarlicPesto_dialogue.Gus.3c: Garlic, oil, and cheese also make it a unique condiment or topping.
Events_GarlicPesto_dialogue.Gus.3d: It's great on bread and pastas.
Events_GarlicPesto_dialogue.Harvey.4b: Consuming too many can lead to experiencing a metallic aftertaste, though. It can last for several weeks.
Events_GarlicPesto_dialogue.Gus.9a: Let's get started making some pesto!
Events_GarlicPesto_dialogue.Gus.9b: First, we’ll start with some fresh pine nuts... This is going to taste so good on some spinach linguini later!
Events_Curry_dialogue.Lewis.3a: It smells so good in here!
Events_Curry_dialogue.Gus.4b: I see a few familiar faces...
Events_Curry_dialogue.Gus.4c: Today I'm going to dive into a dish with so many variations that one can hardly even begin to count them.
Events_Curry_dialogue.Gus.4e: Does anyone have a favorite curry?
Events_Curry_dialogue.Maru.6b: It's got loads of vegetables and a freshness to it I really enjoy.
Events_Curry_dialogue.Willy.8a: Anything with seafood in it! Octopus curry, soup curry, fish amok...
Events_Curry_dialogue.Gus.9b: Willy, I think you'll really enjoy the fish head curry recipe I'm giving out today.
Events_Curry_dialogue.Gus.9c: It uses a whole red snapper!
Events_Curry_dialogue.Gus.9e: All across the world, hundreds of places have their own spin on the dish! There's probably thousands of recipes, no two alike!
Events_Curry_dialogue.Gus.9f: Now, let's start with how to make a curry spice blend.
Events_Curry_dialogue.Gus.9g: While some blends vary, this one is mine.
Events_Curry_dialogue.Gus.9h: We're going to need some coriander and cumin seeds, turmeric, fenugreek, and some spicy peppers...
Events_Curry_dialogue.Gus.9i: Then I want everyone to grab their mortar and pestle, roll up their sleeves, and get ready to pulverize!
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Marnie.2a: No, we're going to cook with it!
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Gus.4b: I see another batch of new faces today!
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Gus.4c: And a few of our regulars, of course.
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Gus.4d: I thought today we'd discuss spices and herbs that really up the level of your cooking game: cumin and coriander.
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Gus.4e: Cumin and coriander are both spices derived from the seeds of their respective plants.
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Jas.5a: Some of these aren't seeds. These leaves say, um... C-I-L-A-N-T-R-O...
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Gus.6a: Good eye, Jas! You sounded out that word beautifully!
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Gus.6b: Some places refer to coriander's leaves as cilantro, but they both come from the same plant.
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Marnie.7a: What do you use them in? I've got both of them on my spice rack, but I don't think I've ever cracked them open...
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Gus.8a: Since cumin brings a warm feeling to cooking, it's great in things you want to add a lot of depth to.
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Gus.8b: Some things just don't taste right without cumin, like the enchilada recipe I've included today.
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Gus.10a: Not on its own, but it does add a lot of robust flavor to things.
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Gus.10b: Coriander or cilantro is also used in things like salsa, though. It gives it that lemony or fresh zest!
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Shane.11a: Mmm... chips and spicy, spicy salsa!
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Gus.12a: Let's cover how much and how to use them best!
Events_CilantroCumin_dialogue.Gus.12c: Er, Shane, maybe you shouldn't eat all the salsa right this second...
Events_Tahini_dialogue.Evelyn.1a: It smells delicious in here, dearie!
Events_Tahini_dialogue.Gus.3b: Penny and @ are back again, I see...
Events_Tahini_dialogue.Gus.3c: That means the first time for everyone else, welcome!
Events_Tahini_dialogue.Gus.3d: Today I'm going to cover the wonderful world of tahini!
Events_Tahini_dialogue.Gus.3e: It can be used in so, so many ways. I'm sure some of you have favorites without even knowing it.
Events_Tahini_dialogue.Gus.3f: It's used in hummus, baba ghanoush, halva and nougat... or as a dip on its own for falafel and shawarma!
Events_Tahini_dialogue.Elliott.4a: Hmm... just that list alone takes me away to tales of the Calico Desert lost to the past, or to a bustling far away bazaar.
Events_Tahini_dialogue.Gus.5a: Tahini is wonderful, bringing out the natural sweetness of the sesame seeds it's made from.
Events_Tahini_dialogue.Leah.6b: What is baba ganoush, though? I've never heard of that one.
Events_Tahini_dialogue.Gus.7b: It uses roasted eggplants and has a wonderfully rich and savory flavor, with a hint of sweetness from the tahini.
Events_Tahini_dialogue.Evelyn.9a: Gus, dearie, you mentioned nougat. Is it often used in desserts?
Events_Tahini_dialogue.Gus.10b: It can be used to flavor cookies, cakes, ice cream... the possibilities are endless!
Events_Tahini_dialogue.Gus.10c: How about we make something sweet and something savory today?
Events_Tahini_dialogue.Gus.10d: Let's get started with some sesame seeds and a mortar and pestle...
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Penny.1b: I usually get here before the lesson to ask Gus some questions. I don't want to interrupt while he's teaching.
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Penny.1c: I guess we're both a little early today.
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Penny.1d: Hmm... I wonder where Gus is?
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.AnswerChoic: It came from the other room.
We should go check it out.
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Gus.6b: I just dropped some of these pepper... guh... guh...
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Penny.7a: Are you sure that's all that's wrong? You seem a little down.
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Gus.8a: Well... I'm a little worried people haven't been really enjoying the lessons.
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Gus.8b: You and @ are the only folks who have come through more than once!
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Gus.8c: Maybe things are a little too detailed or not detailed enough. It can be hard without getting consistent feedback...
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Penny.9b: As a teacher, I know it can feel thankless sometimes.
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Penny.9c: I do think people have been benefitting from your effort, though.
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Penny.9d: I'm sure if you ask after people when they come in, you'll hear lots of good things.
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.AnswerChoic: I think the lessons have been fun.
You've really added a lot of flavor!
Everyone hits a few road bumps...
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Gus.11c: We should probably get ready for whoever comes today.
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Marnie.13a: My family loved your enchiladas, Gus.
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Marnie.13b: Do you have any other good suggestions?
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Maru.14a: Gus! I need to ask you about some details in one of the recipes you gave me. It didn't come out quite right and I don't know what went wrong.
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Lewis.15a: Sorry about all the noise. We had to move some of the chairs!
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Caroline.16: There you are! I grew some basil and want you to have some. That recipe you gave out was wonderful with it.
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Gus.17c: Okay, how about after today's lesson I take some questions?
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Evelyn.18a: Sweetie, would you like some sesame cookies before you get started? I made them after last time...
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Gus.19b: Thank you everyone for coming. Thank you all so much...!
Events_SpiceToTaste_dialogue.Text.20a: It was so great to see everyone at Gus's lesson! It seems like the townspeople have a new love for cooking.
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.1a: There you are! My adventurous helper!
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.1b: Thanks to your hard work, I got my manuscript put together and sent off to my publishers in Zuzu City.
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.1c: They've only been hounding me for it for what, eight years now?
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.1d: I know, I know, I'm the network's biggest money-maker. Of course they're chomping at the bit to publish my first-ever cookbook.
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.1e: But turning the heat up doesn't bake the cake faster!
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.2a: Hmm... Well, I want to give you something as thanks for helping me out. You really saved my bacon!
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.2b: Some of those recipes I learned in villages so remote they can only be reached by hot air balloon...
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.2c: And I'm not on good terms with my balloon guy anymore.
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.2d: So, how about a life-time discount on anything I'm selling? I sense you've got a real spark for the culinary arts and I’d like to fan that spark into a flame!
Events_QoSFinal_string.1: She hands you a napkin with something scribbled on it.
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.4a: My autograph. I don't give those out to just anyone, you know!
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.5a: ...What? Of course I don't look the same way I do on TV!
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.5b: That pink robe and the giant hat, it's all studio hoity-toity. They say it boosts ratings or something. Frilly, unnecessary icing, I say!
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.5c: Me, I'm just here to cook delicious food! Sure, fame is fun and all when you're young, but it loses its zest after a while.
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.5d: Variety is the spice of life, they say, and when you’re bogged down doing the same old, same old, the flavor gets stale.
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.5e: Nowadays, I just want to travel the road like I did back when I was just getting my hands dirty...
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.5f: ...before everyone was calling me to come to this or that restaurant for publicity's sake.
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.5g: I've quite enjoyed having some of that back in my life, traveling around the valley here. I'll probably keep visiting for a while longer...
Events_QoSFinal_dialogue.5h: ...Before I head off on my next adventure, anyway!
Radio_Reminder: There's a new cooking episode on the radio today.
RecipeBook_Breakfast_ImageDescription: This recipe book shows off delicious breakfast foods, such as fresh pancakes and waffles piled high with sour berries and sweet syrup, cheesy scrambled eggs and mushrooms, steaming hot cinnamon oatmeal, and a platter holding slices of apples and oranges.
RecipeBook_ComfortFood_ImageDescription: This recipe book shows a wonderfully welcoming picnic spread with all your favorites. Sandwiches cut into triangles, egg and potato salad, warm macaroni casseroles, and soda cans sticky from the heat of the sun.
RecipeBook_Dessert_ImageDescription: This recipe book shows a massive cherry pie fresh from the oven, the counter around it littered with the tools of labor: a bag of flour, whisks, cracked egg shells, cream and sugar.
RecipeBook_SnackFood_ImageDescription: This recipe book starts off with a bustling night market scene! Vibrant stalls stretch off down the alleyway, with loads of carts selling grilled snacks and trinkets of all sorts. The buttery scent of grilled corn, spiral-cut cheesy fries, and greasy pizza fills the air!
RecipeBook_Northern_ImageDescription: This recipe book shows a rustic tablecloth set with a huge sourdough bread bowl, filled with steaming salmon chowder and a garnish of dill. Not only that, but a platter of sharp cheeses and even lichen completes the meal!
RecipeBook_Savanna_ImageDescription: This recipe book has the cover image of a huge earthenware bowl, laden with a chunky stew made from bitter greens, salty savory fish, oily palm nuts, and spicy chili peppers. Next to it is a plate of plain cassava dough to balance out the richness of the meal.
RecipeBook_Archipelago_ImageDescription: This recipe book displays a day's ocean harvest! The freshest fish and crabs you've ever seen, with coconuts cracked open to show their flesh. Aromatic tropical fruits like mangos and pineapples are piled high on banana tree leaves.
RecipeBook_Woodland_ImageDescription: This recipe book shows a bountiful woodland harvest. A large baked salmon fillet is laid out on a cedar plank, topped with a cranberry and spice berry jam. Spring ferns furl around the dish, tossed with clams and roasted acorns.
RecipeBook_Highland_ImageDescription: This recipe book shows an incredibly fancy spaghetti preparation, like one would see in the most expensive restaurants in Ferngill. A twirl of squid-ink darkened noodles sits in the center of a large polished plate, with only a single stalk of asparagus and a swish of sauce for garnish.
RecipeBook_Mountain_ImageDescription: This recipe book depicts an elegant yet simple meal of marinated eel over a bowl of steaming rice, topped with lightly pickled cabbage garnish. The table is set with a finely painted teapot, a fresh cup of green tea steaming in a small cup.
RecipeBook_InlandSea_ImageDescription: This recipe book shows an assortment of spiced dishes laid out on an intricately woven tablecloth. A wide basket of flatbreads sits in the middle, carrying the fragrance of smoke from the clay ovens. Around it are dishes such as eggplant curry, tossed olive and tomato salad, and mint yogurt sauce!
RecipeBook_Delta_ImageDescription: This recipe book shows a giant pan being tossed over a massive flame! A medley of ingredients jump out of the pan - shrimps, mushrooms, noodles, peppers, leeks, and more! Everything is being wok-fried to delicious perfection.
ChefQuest_description: A mysterious lady asked you for help finding the lost pages of her notebook. Collect lost pages around the valley and turn them in.
InstallationCheck.c: Cornucopia Cooking Recipes will add this many recipes to your game:
InstallationCheck.d: If you want to adjust your mod settings, please read the mod page.
InstallationCheck.e: If you don't need this reminder anymore, you can turn it off in the mod config. Thank you!
config.World Traveler.name: World Traveler
config.World Traveler.description: (Highly recommended) Unlock up to 400 additional recipes under the 'World Traveler' config! A new shopkeeper NPC seeking help with a quest, weekly cooking episodes over the radio, fun cutscenes with villagers, and more! [If you turn World Traveler OFF - You will get the lite version of the mod.]
config.Enable Flexible Recipes.name: Enable Flexible Recipes
config.Enable Flexible Recipes.descripti: (Recommend use with Love of Cooking.) Allows using a wider variety of ingredients, such as using any butter item in recipes which require butter, or using any cheese in recipes which require cheese, and more. Turn this off if you have bugs with cooking recipes.
config.Enable Hyperflexible Recipes.name: Enable Hyperflexible Recipes
config.Enable Hyperflexible Recipes.desc: (HIGHLY RECOMMEND use with Love of Cooking.) Cook with similar items from other mods. For example, SVE cucumbers, or VMV olives, or WAG syrups can be used in Cornucopia recipes. *Be careful of accidentally using ingredients you don't want to lose - balance is not guaranteed.
config.Ingredient Indicator.name: Ingredient Indicator
config.Ingredient Indicator.description: Label hyperflexible ingredients in the cooking menu with this option, letting you know which ingredients can be substituted. Only does something when Enable Hyperflexible Recipes is turned on.
config.Enable Flavored Recipes.name: Enable Flavored Recipes
config.Enable Flavored Recipes.descripti: (Requires Extra Machine Configs, Love of Cooking recommended) With Enable Flexible Recipes or Enable Hyperflexible Recipes turned on, this allows a few recipes to be specially flavored and colored based on the ingredient used to make it. For example, using a Strawberry to make a Fruit Smoothie will result in a Strawberry Smoothie.
config.Enable Vanilla Recipe Changes.des: Tweak a few vanilla recipes slightly to fit Cornucopia's design, ie Chocolate Cake using Chocolate.
config.Patch Duplicate Names.name: Patch Duplicate Names
config.Patch Duplicate Names.description: Changes the name of Baked Potato, Grilled Cheese, and/or Croissant if LoC, SVE, or VMV are installed, to prevent identical recipe names. May or may not change additional duplicate names in the future.
config.Foods Contain Dairy.name: Foods Contain Dairy
config.Foods Contain Dairy.description: A very inconsequential option. Changes the internal data of dairy-containing items to say whether or not they have dairy (for use with BarleyZP's Allergies or NPC gift tastes).
config.Radio Accessibility.name: Radio Accessibility
config.Radio Accessibility.description: Adds a screenreader-accessible text reminder in the morning when a new cooking episode is on the radio, in addition to the default visual reminder.
config.Recipe Book Accessibility.name: Recipe Book Accessibility
config.Recipe Book Accessibility.descrip: For players that use screenreader support, this option replaces the custom recipe book menu with a more intuitive message box that has only text descriptions instead of images.
Gives you a tiny info message in SMAPI letting you know what tier of the mod you have. If you don't need the message anymore, you can turn it off here!
RecipeinaBottle_Found: You found a 'Recipe in a Bottle'! Use this item to discover a new cooking recipe.
